intro: Epidendrum nudosabanillense, commonly known as the Sabanilla orchid, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its long, pendant inflorescences bearing numerous fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocky surfaces, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, with a waxy surface that helps reduce water loss. The flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination by insects.
